name: Tibialis Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Start by standing with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your core muscles to maintain a stable position.
3. Slowly lift one food off the ground, keeping it in line with your ankle, and raise your heel without bending your knee.
4. Hold this position for a brief moment, contracting your calf muscle (Tibialis anterior) and soleus.
5. Lower your foot back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
6. Continue alternating legs and lifting heels for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The tibialis raise is an exercise that targets the muscles in the lower leg, specifically the calf (gastrocnemius), soleus, and peroneal muscles.
